Detailed Description

A 3D polygon.

Polygons may contain more that three points, however, it is not recommened as our graphics system does not guarantee stable results on anything by triangles.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

polygon3D::polygon3D (    ) 
 

Primative Constructor.

Constructs an empty polygon that cannot accept any points.

polygon3D::polygon3D (  int    n ) 
 

Primative Constructor.

Constructs an empty polygon that can contain up to n points.

Parameters:
n  The maximum number of points the polygon will contain.

Member Function Documentation

void polygon3D::addPoint (  point3D    p ) 
 

Adds a point to the polygon.

Parameters:
p  The point to be added.

void polygon3D::render (  matrix &    m,
vector< point3D * > &    pointList,
list< polygonRef3D > &    polygonList
)  [virtual]
 

Renders the primative.

This applies the incoming GTM to all the points in the model and returns the points and polygons forming the model.

Parameters:
m  The incoming GTM
pointList  The global list of points that will contain all points in the scene once everything has rendered.
polygonList  The global list of polygons that will contain all polygons in the scene once everything has rendered.
lightList  The global list of lights that will contain all lights in the scene once everything has rendered.

Implements modelPrimative.

void polygon3D::setFilled (  bool    m ) 
 

Sets whether the polygon will be filled or not.

WARNING: Results unpredictable in 3D with unfilled polygons.

void polygon3D::setFlat (  bool    m ) 
 

Sets whether the polygon will be shaded as if it is flat or not.

WARNING: Results unpredictable in 3D with non-flat polygons.

void polygon3D::setMaterial (  colorVector    kD,
colorVector    kS,
double    nS
) 
 

Sets whether material properties for the polygon.

Parameters:
kD  The coeffient of diffuse reflectence.
kS  The coeffient of specular reflection.
nS  The speculer coefficient.
